TopicTitle: [WIP] NASA SLS - Released: Orion MPCV Core Module 1.0 [4/18/2015]

Articles.Content: looking good! when more of this stuff is completed, I might have to abandon YANFRET's CHAKA Orion mod in favor of this!

Any news? I am in love with your Orion, much better than the Bobcat one included in Chaka Monkey. I also like your SLS, and I would like a separated download. I don't want to download all of the unrealistic Chaka rockets and modules, but only your Orion+SLS. Awesome work by the way, as I was a modeler too I know the struggle. Keep going
Orion by noonespecial on Sketchfab

Fantastic texturing and modelling I can see there! Just the "inter-window" (you now, the faces between the window and the cone model) section looks like the UV would be a bit messed up, but I have currently no reference pictures, so it may be incorrect what I say.
Great looking models, only thing that spoils it are the memory requirements. I wish I could use my 16 GB effectively for KSP. Just imagin how many cool looking mods I could suddenly run.

Any news? I am in love with your Orion, much better than the Bobcat one included in Chaka Monkey. I also like your SLS, and I would like a separated download. I don't want to download all of the unrealistic Chaka rockets and modules, but only your Orion+SLS. Awesome work by the way, as I was a modeler too I know the struggle. Keep going

I understand that you might not want to play with the CHAKA rockets (it's a huge download and all), but if there's one thing they aren't, it's unrealistic.

Any news? I am in love with your Orion, much better than the Bobcat one included in Chaka Monkey. I also like your SLS, and I would like a separated download. I don't want to download all of the unrealistic Chaka rockets and modules, but only your Orion+SLS. Awesome work by the way, as I was a modeler too I know the struggle. Keep going

The Orion, all payloads, and the SLS will be offered as a mod separate from ChakaMonkey.

Fantastic texturing and modelling I can see there! Just the "inter-window" (you now, the faces between the window and the cone model) section looks like the UV would be a bit messed up, but I have currently no reference pictures, so it may be incorrect what I say.

Great looking models, only thing that spoils it are the memory requirements. I wish I could use my 16 GB effectively for KSP. Just imagin how many cool looking mods I could suddenly run.

ChakaMonkey is rather memory heavy, because it has MANY parts and high quality textures. You could practically delete all stock parts and run only a ChakaMonkey game (almost). My SLS will have a much smaller memory foot print, as it will have much fewer overall parts.

The white texture is, unfortunately, on my computer at work. So it'll have to wait until Monday. Then I have to decide logistics: 2 releases, one white one black; 1 base model with optional texture download (which one?), or one of those fancy plugins that allow you to change textures in the VAB. Decisions, decisions.
I'm all for the fancy plugins

Oh yeah the plugin. Please.
Another question: are you still working on SLS? I saw on the previous posts some nice textures.

New RL10 model for SLS (and other things)

(Disclaimer: Picture is a high resolution render of the model with a subsurf modifier, actual model isn't this high poly)

That looks absolutely amazing, really curious to see where this is going.

Do you plan on making a version with an extendable nozzle?

Here is the new engine integrated into the second stage ICPS.

In other news, I'm shopping for texture replacement plugin to include both the white and black Orion textures in the mod. So far I've tried Firespitter (with no luck, can't even get the contextual menu to display in the VAB).

Have you looked at how blackheart done KerbalStockLauncherOverhaul mod 

MODULE
 {
	name = FStextureSwitch2
	moduleID = 0
	objectNames = kxlong
	textureRootFolder = KerbalStockLauncherOverhaul/Parts/FuelTank/KXtank/
	textureNames = texture1;texture2;texture4;texture3;texture5;texture6
	mapNames = texture1_NRM;texture2_NRM;texture2_NRM;texture2_NRM;texture2_NRM;texture3_NRM
	textureDisplayNames = Kerbal X;No Decal;Kerbodyne;Rockomax;Black;FLT
	switchableInFlight = false
	mapIsNormal = true
	repaintableEVA = false
	useFuelSwitchModule = false
 }

Or there is FusTek which looks like 

@PART[IACBM125m]
{
	MODULE
	{
		name = FStextureSwitch2

		moduleID = 0

		objectNames = fin;lamp_red;lamp_standard;main_ring;motion_controller;pwr_data;ring_rail

		textureNames = FusTek/Station Parts/Parts/IACBM_1.25_texture

		mapNames = FusTek/Station Parts/Parts/IACBM_1.25_bump_NRM

		textureDisplayNames = FusTek Classic

		nextButtonText = Next Style
		prevButtonText = Previous Style

		statusText = Module Panel Style

		switchableInFlight = false

		additionalMapType = _BumpMap

		mapIsNormal = true

		repaintableEVA = false

		showPreviousButton = false

		useFuelSwitchModule = false

		fuelTankSetups = 0

		updateSymmetry = false

		showInfo = false
	}		
}

hope it helps.

EDIT- And dam wish ksp parts looked like the pictures you are posting that would make one happy kerbal.
